repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: Dolores Carrara was a radio actress and dancer. This collection includes scripts from programs broadcast on the radio station WGY and television station WRGB based in Schenectady, NY.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Born on Janaury 29, 1929, Dolores I. Carrara (nee Serapilio) started dancing, acting, and singing for radio stations at just three years old. Some of her first radio apperances at the WGY station in Schenectady, N.Y. included dancing for the shows "Children's Jamboree" and "Tell Me A Story." Carrara also did a Christmas Eve special for the WGY radio station in which she sang two songs that were broadcast in South America. As she got older, Carrara modeled for General Electic and was a regular actress on WGY's "FBI in Action" radio show.

Carrara also took dance lessons from Florence Sanford and eventually moved to Miami with her husband where she worked on shows for the WTVJ commerical radio. Eventually Carrara moved back to Schenectady, N.Y. and became a secretary at a local library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains scripts that Dolores I. Carrara used when starring in radio shows. Programs in the collection include episodes of Dear Chollie and The Ted Malone Show and an adaptation of Jane Eyre. The majority of radio scripts are episodes of The FBI in Action.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically. There are no series.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Dolores I. Carrara donated all items in 2004.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Dolores I. Carrara Papers, 1946-1947. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Carrara Papers).
